message.content:
cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on improving the performance of a human-robot team in a shared autonomy setting, which involves integrating user input with robot autonomy to control a robot and complete a task. This falls under the category of robotics (cs.RO) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI), as the paper proposes a formalism for mutual adaptation between the human and robot. The paper also addresses challenges related to human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and system and control theory (cs.SY), as the human and robot goals are not fully observable and the robot's actions can change the physical state of the world. Finally, the paper uses a partially observable stochastic decision model, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG).
